Our commitment to maximizing ROI has led to generating over $50,000,000 in profitable returns for our clients in the past three years.

title: Consultant
description: About Us: KYROS Insights is the only actuarial firm solely focused on loyalty programs. We need someone with experience working collaboratively in a team environment, exceptional analytical skills, and a solid understanding of the basics of predictive modeling. Duties and responsibilities: The primary responsibilities for the role are: 1. Perform actuarial analyses for client projects *The candidate will work with analysts and data scientists to perform actuarial analyses rooted in machine learning to estimate and forecast loyalty program liability and customer lifetime value (CLV). Although this role does not require knowledge of actuarial science or any specific programming language, strong analytical skills and comfort with large datasets are necessary. A basic understanding of predictive modeling is important. Basic python and SQL skills are a plus. 2. Synthesizing the outputs of predictive models into a coherent narrative to present to clients and other stakeholders *The candidate must be an effective communicator who can clearly distill complex concepts into language that non-technical audiences can understand. *The candidate must also be proficient in data visualization and presentation tools to craft and deliver a compelling message to clients. 3. Entrepreneurial Mindset *The candidate will be asked to solve a wide variety of open-ended business problems where a known solution does not exist. The candidate will need to have an entrepreneurial mindset to build a creative solution to those problems. *The candidate must be highly self-motivated and have a bias for action in order the solve problems with little guidance. *We are constantly innovating, which involves iteratively searching through a solutions space without an exact understanding of what will work. Consequently, the candidate will need to be comfortable with ambiguity in order to make progress in this environment. 4. Working extremely fast *We manage a lot of client projects simultaneously with aggressive deadlines. Our consultants need to be fast, getting the work done in about half the time it would take other people. Minimum Qualifications: Qualifications include: * Years of Experience: 5+ years of professional experience in a highly analytical role that has an advisory component that requires strong communication skills (e.g., consulting work, or in-house work that involves presenting results to advise business decisions) * Education: Undergraduate degree in quantitative field * Skills: -Exceptionally strong with Excel, PowerPoint -Understanding of the basics of predictive modeling * Abilities: Strong communicator, growth mindset, ability to independently prioritize work and get things done, exceptional work ethic and the ability to get things done in about half the time it would take other people. title: Looker Studio and SQL Expert for Dashboard Optimization
description: Greetings! I am on the lookout for a seasoned expert in Looker Studio to assist with the optimization of a dashboard. This dashboard tracks and displays call and sales logs made by our life coaching team. The underlying data for this dashboard is stored in a MySQL database. The primary objective is to enhance the data retrieval speed and overall display efficiency. Project Background: My current hypothesis is that Looker might be fetching all available data and applying filters at the front end, causing delays. To streamline this, I'm considering implementing custom SQL queries with parameterized date ranges to filter the data at the database level, thereby pulling only the essential data. Key Responsibilities: Evaluate my optimization strategy and provide feedback. Is the assumption about Looker's data retrieval process accurate? Would this strategy indeed expedite the data fetching process? Thoroughly analyze the existing dashboard setup, paying close attention to filters, merges, and other configurations. Develop optimized queries that minimize data fetching time. Transition the dashboard to utilize the newly crafted queries as its data source. Requirements: Proven experience with Looker Studio, specifically in dashboard optimization. Strong proficiency in SQL, especially in crafting efficient queries. Familiarity with MySQL databases. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Effective communication abilities to provide insights, recommendations, and clarifications. Project Timeline: I am keen on initiating this project promptly and would appreciate a quick turnaround. Please outline your availability and an estimated completion timeframe in your proposal. In your application, do share relevant Looker Studio projects you've executed, especially any optimizations you've undertaken. Any insights or suggestions you might have about the project right off the bat will also be valued. Looking forward to collaborating with a skilled Looker Studio professional!

description: We want to get a better picture of the adhesive and sealant market size in NZ and Australia. These tables have a lot of detail, values, arrival port etc, but there would still be a certain amount of assumption to any interpretation, as we don’t know all the products that go into these classes. 3214 – sealants, including silicones etc. will need further breakdown within this HS code. 3506 – adhesives, - sub classes within this heading 3909500990 – Polyurethanes in primary forms 3910000919 – silicones in primary forms We need to get this type of data into a more readable format for AU and NZ (independently) - it would be good to have some easy to read visuals under the key headings for each country There may be other data sets online that you can pull from but this is a good starting point.

title: Looking for data analyst for Analyze Data and Provide Recommendations
description: Business Insights through Data-DAT-3533-BMFIN1 Objetive: Choose a company, analyze its internal data and external data (industry data or data from a competitor) and give 3 specific recommendations to the CEO. 1) Insights from the data you analyzed that can link to an innovation or future action i.e. explore a new product or innovation in certain region based on current positive performance and trends in the industry 2) Correlations of metrics analyzed and results. i.e. Pricing models have had a direct impact in sales and hence should be considered for future years. 3) Projections using regressions: A regression model that predicts profits can give the CEO a hint of what variables to consider for future planning How would you measure the success of these recommendations? Make sure you select a company that has public available data or that can provide the data your need for this analysis. If you have challenges getting internal or external data, you can create your own data set as a last resource. Here is the link for Ibis world where you can find industry data to analyze and compare to https://my-ibisworld-com.hult.idm.oclc.org/ Due date: Session 7 Phase 1 Descriptive Statistics Using descriptive statistics, present your assessment of this business by analyzing different segments, regions, or products. Compare the results of these measurements and share your conclusions. Identify if there are any KPIs related to ESG and present them clearly. What is their impact? Present your findings using the results obtained and visuals. Show which data you decided to highlight and what measures you used. Phase 2 Measures of Association Identify variables that have significant relationships among them. Describe the relationship in terms of strength and direction. Identify variables that may have a causation relationship. Propose a course of action to validate your assumptions. Identify if there are any KPIs related to ESG and present them clearly. What is their impact? Present your findings using the results obtained and visuals. Show which data you decided to highlight and what measures you used. Phase 3 Normal Distribution Identify relevant metrics that follow a normal distribution. • Explain why this variable follows this trend based on your knowledge of this business. Are there outliers that are worth investigating further? • Are there any other variables that follow a normal distribution? Identify if there are any KPIs related to ESG and present them clearly. What is their impact? Present your findings using the results obtained and visuals. Show which data you decided to highlight and what measures you used. Deliverable: 1) Power Point • Based on your work on Phases 1 to 4, provide a prioritized summary of your findings. • In all phases, identify if there are any KPIs related to ESG and present them clearly. What is their impact? Give 3 specific recommendations to the CEO for next steps. Support your recommendations with data and insights from your analysis and trusted sources. • How would you measure the success of these recommendations? Length of your Power Point Document: Maximum 10 slides 2) Excel Supporting Data Analyses, Charts, Trends, and Regressions (1 tab per phase) Pointers/Guidelines: • All your recommendations need to be strongly supported with Data Analysis completed in Excel. • At your discretion apply insights from Annual Report, WSJ and other trusted data sources to support and strengthen your analysis and recommendations. Be clear in your source annotations. Other potential Sources: You have access to IBIS world where you can find industry data that supports your analysis • Excel should include (1) descriptive statistics, (2) measures of associations, a (3) normal distribution and at least (4) one regression and (5) additional company/industry/relevant data. • Charts need to be created and formatted as well. • Last sheet of Excel should have references for all your data sources. Proper citation is required. Note: Wikipedia or ChatGPT is not considered a trusted source.

In summary, we are looking for a data analyst who can provide us with actionable insights and a clear visual representation of our sales data. title: Data Analyst to analyze flight / airport data for study
description: We are a German based consumer rights platform offering help with compensation for consumers towards airlines in terms of flight cancellation and delays. Therefore we are planning to launch a short study about the flight traffic in connection with Germany in order to be mentioned / referenced in the media. The focus of the study shall be flight traffic in Germany, popular holiday regions and other interesting findings. We are looking for a data analyst who will analyze two given datasets. One of all takeoffs from German airports and their destinations in the last 10 years. The datasets show the destination airports of aircraft that take off from German airports. The second one shows all arrivals at German airports and their starting country in the last 10 years. 28 German airports and 231 destination countries are considered. For each month, the number of flights from the German airport to the respective country is shown. The period from January 2011 to August 2023 is considered. We are asking you to look for interesting findings in the data that would be compelling or fascinating and would catch the interest of the audience → most important and answer the following questions (list is not exhaustive). Findings shall be presented as a table or reporting with a short explanatory sentence / text to conclude the finding. We suggest to work in a shared folder on our Google Drive. We are also happy to discuss the scope and style of the project along with your experience. Questions: About airports: Which airports have the highest and lowest flight volumes? Which airports have the most destination countries? Which German airports have expanded or upgraded their infrastructure in recent years to cope with rising demand? What impact did the COVID 19 pandemic have on aircraft movements? Which months have the highest or lowest number of aircraft movements? Which airports have the most arrivals? How is the arrival-departure ratio for each airport? About destinations: Which countries are the most frequent destinations from German airports? Which countries have the most arrivals in Germany? Which destination countries are frequent destinations for long-haul flights, and which for short-haul flights? Rank for each airport the Top 10 destinations Is there a peak visible during certain times that might be connected with religious festivities such as Christmas or others? How has the flight traffic changed regarding flights to crisis regions and / or regions affected by sanctions such as a) near and middle east, b) Russia, c) Ukraine? Which countries are served most in winter months (January, February, March)? Which ones are the least? Which countries are served most in summer (June, July, August)? Which ones are the least? Are there seasonal changes in terms of arrivals in Germany? Looking forward to talk to you and discuss the project.

title: PowerBI consultant - report loading speed from Tabular model
description: Within our company we have a large number of PowerBI report. Most reports are connected using SSAS tabular models, others are connected via SQL databases, sharepoint data sources, etc. One of our most important reports which provides management daily insights has been slow to load and often even times out. We have optimised this report, but it is still loading slow and the interactive features don’t always work. The report sometimes loads quick, other times loading can take 30 minutes or even more. The report that was loading within seconds and was able be used dynamically by our users. However, the report started loading slowly about 2.5 months ago without a clear reason or changes we made to the report/server. We are aware of the following optimisations that can be applied to speed up PBI loading (in progress): - Update OS to a more recent version - Update SSAS to a more recent version - Create an optimised tabular model data source (eg apply indexes, fact/dimension table structure) - Remove columns/data points within the tabular model that are not required - Archive data (older than 2 years) However, these were not in place 2.5 months ago either, hence they don’t explain the recent increase in time this specific report required to load. First part of the objective is to resolve the slow loading of this key report. This will be followed by providing more general recommendation and suggestions to improve our PowerBI set-up. Objectives • Improve speed of a report loading from a SSAS tabular model (less than 10 seconds) • Provide recommendations to improve our powerbi set-up to improve loading of all powerbi reports • Work closely with our Data Analysts and Tabular model developer to implement the recommendations. Required experience • 5+ years PowerBI • 3+ years SSAS tabular models • 3+ years SQL Skills • Experience in creating and managing tabular models • Experience in creating and optimising PowerBI reports • Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration and training • Proficient in writing well-written, self-documenting code that follows best practices and design Milestones 1. Providing and applying improvements to the slow loading PowerBI report 2. Present implemented improvements to Flash BI team 3. Written report based on a review of other reports to provide more generic recommendations to improve our PowerBI set-up. Report to include practical examples. 4. Present recommendations to Flash BI team 5. Potential for a longer term engagement for building reports Proposal instructions Provide examples of previous PowerBI dashboards that extract data from Tabular models with methods applied to optimise reports load quickly.

description: **Job Title: Healthcare Data Analyst using ChatGPT** **Location:** Asia **Job Type:** Full-time **Company Overview:** DripDok is a leading healthcare organization dedicated to improving patient outcomes through data-driven insights and innovative technologies. We are seeking a talented and passionate Healthcare Data Analyst to join our team and leverage the power of ChatGPT to enhance our data analytics capabilities. **Job Summary:** As a Healthcare Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in transforming the way we analyze healthcare data and extract valuable insights. You will harness the capabilities of ChatGPT to assist in natural language processing, generate reports, answer medical queries, and support data-driven decision-making. Your work will directly impact patient care, operational efficiency, and strategic planning within the healthcare organization. **Key Responsibilities:** 1. **Data Analysis:** Utilize ChatGPT to analyze large volumes of healthcare data, including electronic health records, medical claims, patient feedback, and more, to extract meaningful insights. 2. **Natural Language Processing (NLP):** Develop and implement NLP models using ChatGPT to understand and process unstructured healthcare text data, enabling efficient data extraction and sentiment analysis. 3. **Data Cleaning and Preprocessing:** Prepare data for analysis by cleaning, normalizing, and structuring datasets to ensure data accuracy and consistency. 4. **Healthcare Report Generation:** Create automated healthcare reports and dashboards using ChatGPT, presenting actionable insights to healthcare providers, administrators, and other stakeholders. 5. **Clinical Decision Support:** Assist healthcare professionals by generating detailed responses to medical queries using ChatGPT, helping in diagnosis, treatment recommendations, and patient education. 6. **Quality Improvement:** Collaborate with healthcare teams to identify areas for quality improvement based on data-driven findings and implement solutions to enhance patient care. 7. **Statistical Analysis:** Perform statistical analyses to identify trends, correlations, and patterns in healthcare data, contributing to evidence-based decision-making. 8. **Data Security and Compliance:** Ensure the protection of sensitive healthcare data by adhering to all relevant data security and privacy regulations, including HIPAA. 9. **Documentation:** Maintain comprehensive documentation of data analysis methodologies and findings for future reference and auditing purposes. **Qualifications:** - Bachelor's or Master's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field. - Proven experience in healthcare data analysis and NLP. - Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and data analysis tools like Pandas, NumPy, and TensorFlow. - Familiarity with machine learning techniques, data visualization, and healthcare data standards. - Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with healthcare professionals and cross-functional teams. - Knowledge of healthcare industry regulations and compliance (HIPAA, HITECH, etc.). - Problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a passion for improving healthcare through data. **Benefits:** - Competitive salary and benefits package. - Opportunities for career growth and professional development. - Work in a dynamic and collaborative healthcare environment. - Contribute to cutting-edge data analytics projects using ChatGPT. If you are passionate about healthcare, data analysis, and the potential of AI-driven solutions, we invite you to apply for the Healthcare Data Analyst position. Join us in making a meaningful impact on the healthcare industry and improving patient outcomes through data-driven insights.

title: Data Analyst - Maternal Access to Health Services
description: Job Summary: We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst with expertise in spatial analysis and machine learning to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets related to maternal health access, with a focus on late ANC initiation. Your main tasks will include conducting spatial autocorrelation tests, performing OLS regression, and utilizing geographically weighted regression (GWR) to account for spatial heterogeneity. Additionally, you will use Arc GIS or Arc Map for spatial analysis and Python for machine learning to identify determinants of late ANC initiation and simulate the impact of interventions. The successful candidate will possess a strong background in statistical analysis, experience in working with big datasets, and advanced skills in Arc GIS or Arc Map and Python. Responsibilities: - Collect and curate large datasets related to maternal health, including demographic, socioeconomic, geographic, and health facility data. - Perform data cleaning, transformation, and validation to ensure data accuracy and consistency. - Conduct global Moran's I test to identify spatial autocorrelation in late ANC initiation across individual countries. - Use OLS regression to determine which predictor variables to include in the analysis. - Assess the OLS regression model for statistical significance of coefficients, directional relationships, multicollinearity, and normality of residuals. - Utilize the Koenker Bp technique to examine the consistency of the relationships between explanatory variables and the dependent variable in geographic space. - Check the strength of the R-squared value to measure the proportion of late ANC initiation explained by independent variables. - Implement geographically weighted regression (GWR) to account for spatial heterogeneity in the relationships between variables. - Use Arc GIS or Arc Map for spatial analysis, including mapping the results of GWR models. - Apply Python for machine learning techniques to identify determinants of late ANC initiation and simulate the impact of interventions. - Use inverse distance weighting (IDW) to generate smooth surfaces for visualization and data generation at the province level. - Collaborate with subject matter experts to understand the context and develop relevant variables for analysis. - Conduct data mining and exploratory data analysis to uncover hidden patterns, trends, and associations. - Develop and implement data visualization techniques to present findings in a clear and concise manner, targeting both technical and non-technical stakeholders. - Collaborate with the research team to formulate research questions and hypotheses based on the analysis findings. - Provide regular reports and updates on the progress of the analysis and present findings to stakeholders. - Stay up to date with the latest advancements in data analysis techniques, statistical models, spatial analysis tools, and machine learning algorithms. Overview and Descriptive Analysis: • Provide a brief overview of the dataset, summarizing the economic growth forecasts for the year 2023. • Conduct a descriptive analysis, highlighting key statistics and trends. 2. Top Economic Performers: • Identify and analyze the top-performing countries based on economic growth forecasts for 2023. What factors might be contributing to their high growth rates? 3. Historical Context: • Consider the historical data available. Are there notable patterns or events in the economic history of these countries that might influence their future growth? 4. Global Rankings: • Examine the global ranks assigned to each country. What insights can be gained from these rankings, and how do they correlate with economic forecasts? 5. Forecast Comparison: • Compare the economic growth forecasts for 2023 with historical data. Are there significant changes or trends compared to previous years? 6. Data Validation: • Check for data consistency and completeness. Ensure that the available data is reliable and aligns with historical economic trends. 7. Visualization: • Create visualizations (charts, graphs, etc.) to represent the economic growth forecasts and historical trends. Visuals can enhance the understanding of the data.

Sometimes these transactions start in one month and end in another month. We need to develop a report that recognizes revenue ratably across days through reservations stay period and accrues revenue in the appropriate month. We currently have an excel model that does this but we want this to be a standard report in quicksight. We are looking for someone to create an automated solution (potentially formula based) within QuickSight that calculates the GAAP revenue for every reservation. title: Basic Statistical Analysis of Job Data
description: Attached is the data set. Task: Develop analytical insights such as: Department Distribution: There are several departments mentioned like "Board-Central Administration", "CC-Center of Excellence", "CC-Central Administration", "CC-Collections and Escalations", and "CC-Contact Center". "CC-Contact Center" seems to have the highest number of employees, followed by "CC-Collections and Escalations". Salary Distribution: Salaries range from as low as around $53,400 (for a Receptionist) to as high as $188,999.85 (for a Director, Customer Care). The highest salary ($188,999.85) is in the "CC-Central Administration" department, whereas the lowest ($53,400.05) is in the "CC-Collections and Escalations" department. Position Analysis: There are various positions such as "Secretary to the Board", "Program Manager SAP", "Operations Analyst", "Collections Analyst II", "Customer Care Associate", etc. The position "Customer Care Associate" in the "CC-Contact Center" department is the most common one. Union vs. Non-Union: There are both Union and Non-Union positions in the data. Non-Union Grade 17 and Union A01 DS 09 seem to be the most recurring grades. Tenure: The start dates for employees range from 1984 to 2023. Some employees have been with the company for nearly 4 decades (e.g., an employee from the "CC-Contact Center" started in 1984), while some are very new, having started in 2023. Salary Bands: A good percentage of employees earn between $70,000 and $100,000. Only a few positions command salaries greater than $150,000. Bilingual Employees: There are specific positions for bilingual employees, termed as "Customer Care Associate (Blgl)" in the "CC-Contact Center" department. Average Salary by Department: Board-Central Administration: $170,000.00 CC-Center of Excellence: $118,703.65 (average of 3 employees) CC-Central Administration: $146,944.40 (average of 3 employees) CC-Collections and Escalations: $87,394.10 (average of 11 employees) CC-Contact Center: $82,358.93 (average of 33 employees) Average Tenure by Department: Considering 2023 as the current year: Board-Central Administration: 0 years CC-Center of Excellence: 9 years (average) CC-Central Administration: 8.6 years (average) CC-Collections and Escalations: 9.1 years (average) CC-Contact Center: 7.7 years (average) 3. Distribution of Union vs. Non-Union Positions: Non-Union Positions: 18 employees Union Positions: 39 employees Highest & Lowest Salaries by Department: Board-Central Administration: Highest: $170,000.00, Lowest: $170,000.00 CC-Center of Excellence: Highest: $155,209.82, Lowest: $98,772.88 CC-Central Administration: Highest: $188,999.85, Lowest: $105,285.40 CC-Collections and Escalations: Highest: $121,338.00, Lowest: $53,400.05 CC-Contact Center: Highest: $129,541.05, Lowest: $70,803.20 Department-wise Bilingual Employees: Only the "CC-Contact Center" department has specific bilingual positions, with 3 bilingual employees. Number of Employees by Union Grade: The most common union grades are: Non Union Grade 15: 8 employees Non Union Grade 17: 7 employees Union A01 DS 09: 27 employees Positions with the Highest and Lowest Turnover: "Customer Care Associate" in the "CC-Contact Center" seems to have a higher turnover with diverse hiring dates, indicating regular hiring for this position. Positions like "Director, Customer Care" and "Secretary to the Board" seem to have very low turnover, given there's only one entry for each. Conclusions: The "CC-Contact Center" has the most number of employees, but they also have one of the lower average salaries among the departments. The "CC-Collections and Escalations" department has employees with a higher average tenure. Union positions are more prevalent than Non-Union ones. Bilingual positions are exclusive to the "CC-Contact Center" department, indicating a specialized need.

title: Analyse a video game dataset to prototype recommender system algorithms
description: We are analysing video game profiles to predict real-world attributes about the player for use in work and education. We're looking for a data analyst / data engineer to create prototype models of our first proposed designs, for easy integration into a beta product. Here's some more info on the proposed model: In general, we aim to correlate in-depth video games assessment data to a wide variety of in-depth third-party measurements. Before we invest in collecting the challenging data on both sides of the predictive equation to do this, we propose building a simpler model, that just uses the video game data we have already collected to predict job titles, job category, or seniority from gaming preference. Potentially, we ought to be able to identify developers versus artists from game titles, genres, and achievements. Do developers, artists, media personalities, and finance executives all play the same video games? Let's prototype model to correlate video game data in the form of games, genres, game hours, genre hours, and achievements to resume data sufficient to identify professionals as either developers or artists, likely using job titles, years experience, keyword identification in resume text, employers, and degree titles.

title: Data analyst to help us work out customer LTV

I am unable to determine if customers are returning organically or if we're paying to acquire them each time they return. We wish to use the following data to get meaningful insights Product 1 first purchase Apply customer unique ID Product + SKU + one time purchase of subscription Product Category Product price and cogs Quantity Date purchased Date shipped Entry route for first purchase Cost of entry route Geographic location Subsequent customer purchase for unique customer ID Product(s) + SKU + one time purchase of subsscription Product category Differentiate between if it's the same category or new category as first product Product price and cogs Quantity Date purchased Date shipped Entry route for subsequent purchase Cost of entry route Geographic location Use the above date to give the following Company-level analysis of purchases by entry routes (count and cost) by month - so the cost to acquire a customer buying product A, split by entry route, and the volume of customers that bought product A from that entry route every month. Customer level analysis of purchases by entry routes (count and cost) - as above Lifetime value of each customer for each product purchased by cumulative month Overall lifetime value by product by cumulative month Company level analysis of number of customers buying 1,2,3,4 etc products split between subscription products and repeat one time purchases Measure of frequency of purchase (repeat and other) We track this information in our CRM that is connected to zoho analytics (similar to power bi or Tablau) Work will be done via remote screen share.

title: Python data analyst
description: I have a dataset of property and real estate transactions to analyze and dissect I need someone familiar with python and the google colab environment to help me with basic data analysis I'm not a data analyst but learnt some from youtube. I know what is pandas, seaborn etc. But I don't use them as my job is not related to data analysis. One example of a data analysis on the dataset is Property was bought by person A in 2000. Person A sold it to person B in 2005. I want to calculate the profit between year 2000 and 2005. Person B then sold it to person C in 2020. I want to calculate the profit. The property can be identified by the address, which is repeated in the datasets. The whole dataset is 500k rows. Too many to use excel. I don't know how to write the code to extract the profit from these transactions or do the analysis. Another example is to calculate where the profit is highest. Is it in region A, B or C? Another example is to calculate whether the profit is high if some bought in 2008 (when prices were low during global financial crisis), or 2010 (when prices became very high after the global financial crisis). Conversely, see which properties lost money when they were transacted. Also do other basic descriptive and exploratory data analysis. Dataset is in csv. Need someone to start from scratch. Load the data into colab, write the code, produce the visualizations. I will think of more things to explore in the dataset as we go along. Separately, you need to be patient as I may want to learn the basics of the code. There is no extreme regression or machine learning or AI or neural network needed for this project. But if you have ideas to use the dataset in interesting ways I am happy to hear it. For example, doing hedonic regression which is commonly used in the property industry to produce automated valuations. Or combine the property transaction data with map or spatial data like amenities, transport, shopping malls, school etc. nearby to do plotting. Examples of columns in the dataset are property name, address, region, district, price of sale, year of sale, purchaser background. There are a few others. I am at GMT+8 We will chat on upwork and use the zoom function here if we have video calls. I will send a copy of the dataset to those shortlisted.
